sentences.en: A cold little fear was beginning to throb in Scarlett's breast. More miles of rifle pits!
sentences.cn: 思嘉心里隐隐感到有点恐惧,挖更多的散兵壕 啊 !

sentences.en: A dull pain began to throb behind his lids.
sentences.cn: 他的眼皮后面开始隐隐作痛地抽动。

sentences.en: A throb of pain ran through my back.
sentences.cn: 一阵疼痛贯穿了我的背部.

sentences.en: A throb of pain shot through his head.
sentences.cn: 他的头部忽感一阵剧痛.

sentences.en: For days after I met you, something seemed to throb in my veins.
sentences.cn: 遇到你以后, 好几天,我的血管里都仿佛有东西在跳动.

sentences.en: Her head was beginning to throb, her shoulders to ache.
sentences.cn: 她的头开始颤悸, 肩膀开始作痛.

sentences.en: His tooth had started to throb painfully again.
sentences.cn: 他的牙又开始抽痛了。

sentences.en: I haven't even learned to recognise it for what it is yet, and its presentation varies, sometimes a low-level throb of unease, sometimes a lurching panic.
sentences.cn: 我甚至还没有真正认识它是什么，它的表现变化多端，有时候是一种轻微的不安悸动，有时候是一种突如其来的恐慌。

sentences.en: I woke up with a throbbing headache .
sentences.cn: 我醒来时脑袋阵阵作痛。

sentences.en: Jake's head jerked up at the throb of the engine.
sentences.cn: 听到发动机的轰鸣声，杰克猛地抬起了头。

sentences.en: My heart gave a throb.
sentences.cn: 我的心悸动了一下.

sentences.en: Once again he felt the throb of the recognition and regret.
sentences.cn: 他又因认出和遗憾而感到心跳不已.

sentences.en: Presently George's ankle began to throb with pain.
sentences.cn: 不一会儿，乔治的脚踝就开始一阵阵地疼。

sentences.en: She felt her heart give a great throb.
sentences.cn: 她感到自己的心怦地跳了一下.

sentences.en: The ache was subsiding into a dull throb.
sentences.cn: 疼痛渐渐消退,变成隐隐的搏动了.

sentences.en: The back of my neck throbbed painfully.
sentences.cn: 我的后颈阵阵抽痛。

sentences.en: The bruise on his stomach ached with a steady throb.
sentences.cn: 他腹部的擦伤一直阵阵作痛。

sentences.en: The drums seemed to throb in his ears.
sentences.cn: 阵阵鼓声彷佛在他耳边震响.

sentences.en: The excruciating pain of the first blast is gone, and now there is the throb and ache of an amputated soul.
sentences.cn: 第一次爆发的极度痛苦已经消失，现在有的是一个被截去一部分的灵魂的悸动和疼痛。

sentences.en: The first impulse to write this novel is described as a throb.
sentences.cn: 写这本小说的第一冲动就被描绘成悸动。

trans.tran_cn: 悸动；抽动；颤动；跳动着作痛；充满活力
trans.tran_en: if a part of your body throbs, you have a feeling of pain in it that regularly starts and stops
